      • findSubset

        public static int[] findSubset(int[] numbers,
               int target)
        Find the return subset of numbers such that the sum of the numbers in the subset is exactly equal to target, assuming that at least one solution exists
        Parameters:
        numbers - the array to be tested
        Returns:
        subset that all its elements add up to target

      • randomArray

        public static int[] randomArray(int size,
                int limit,
                int seed)
        Creates an array of random numbers in the range 1 to limit. No number will occur more than once in this array, but all calls with the same value of seed will return the same sequence of numbers, regardless of the size of the array.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the array to create.
        limit - All returned numbers will be less than or equal to this value.
        seed - A seed for the random number generator.
        Returns:
        An array of unique random numbers.

      • randomize

        public static void randomize(int[] array)
        Randomizes an array in place.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to be randomized (shuffled).

      • createProblem

        public static int[] createProblem(int sum,
                  int numbers,
                  int piles)
        Divide a given number, sum, into numbers addends, such that the addends sum to the given number, and the addends can be partitioned into piles equal piles.
        Parameters:
        sum - The number to be broken into addends.
        numbers - The desired number of addends.
        piles - The desired number of piles.
        Returns:
        An array of numbers to be sorted into piles.
